medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms of abdominal pain began 6 days ago, located in the epigastric region and radiating to the back. The patient has had stomach and chest discomfort after eating, with a 5 days history of inability to keep food or liquid down. Vomiting has occurred immediately after eating or up to 10 minutes after, with brown material noted possibly resembling coffee grounds. An 8-pound weight loss was reported in the past week.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Anemia requiring iron infusions, history of gastric bypass surgery for gastric ulcer, history of brain bleed in the thalamus, meningiomas currently managed, prior cholecystectomy, appendectomy, hysterectomy with removal of one ovary, history of three C-sections, removal of a growth under the scalp.
medical_history.family_history: Father with ulcers and cancer of unknown origin; mother died of sepsis related to pneumonia; brother with gastrointestinal problems.
